channel.title: Pages on SociLabs
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on SociLabs

item.title: About
item.description: What is SociLabs? SociLabs is an initiative started by Sean Doody, a sociology PhD candidate and computational sociologist at George Mason University, to serve as a codelab repository consisting of tutorials, examples, and other useful information for sociologists interested in data science and computational methods. Who is this for? Initially, the target audience was envsioned to be sociology graduate students new to programming who are interested in using computational and data science methods in their research, including machine learning, natural language processing, data management, interacting with APIs, etc.
